title: Air Force selects Pacific landing sites to test space cargo deliveries
summary:
The military will seek environmental approval for two landing pads at Johnston Atoll

title: Firefly Aerospace aces Moon landing on first attempt
summary: The successful touchdown marks the beginning of a planned 14-day mission on the lunar surface. The Blue Ghost lander is designed to power down after operating for a few hours into the lunar nighttime, which begins on March 16.

title: Firefly Lands on the Moon
summary: Firefly Aerospace’s Blue Ghost Mission 1 landed on the Moon early this morning.  The third of NASA’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services or CLPS missions, the commercial lunar lander delivered 10 […]

title: Touchdown! Carrying NASA Science, Firefly’s Blue Ghost Lands on Moon
summary: Carrying a suite of NASA science and technology, Firefly Aerospace’s Blue Ghost Mission 1 successfully landed at 3:34 a.m. EST on Sunday near a volcanic feature called Mons Latreille within Mare Crisium, a more than 300-mile-wide basin located in the northeast quadrant of the Moon’s near side. The Blue Ghost lander is in an upright […]

title: Firefly’s Blue Ghost 1 lands on the moon
summary:
Firefly Aerospace’s Blue Ghost 1 lunar landed touched down on the surface of the moon March 2.
The post Firefly’s Blue Ghost 1 lands on the moon appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: Firefly Aerospace attempts first Moon landing with Blue Ghost
summary: The robotic lander will attempt to touch down on the lunar surface at Mare Crisium near Mons Latreille Sunday morning. The anticipated landing time is no earlier than 3:34 a.m. EST (0834 UTC).

title: FAA gives approval for next Starship test flight
summary:
The FAA has given its approval for the next flight of SpaceX’s Starship even while the investigation into the failed previous flight continues.
The post FAA gives approval for next Starship test flight appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission comes a day after announcing they crossed 5 million subscribers to the Starlink internet service. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 9:24 p.m. EST (0224 UTC).

title: Varda Space capsule lands in Australia with critical data for hypersonic vehicles
summary:
After spending six weeks in orbit, the capsule touched down at the Koonibba Test Range in South Australia

title: Sentinel-2A Given One-Year Exceptional and Temporary Extension
summary:
The European Space Agency has announced that the Sentinel-2A satellite has received a one-year extension, delaying its planned retirement. As part of the European Commission’s Copernicus programme, the Sentinel-2 mission delivers high-resolution optical imagery for land monitoring. This data supports agriculture, forestry, disaster response, and environmental protection by tracking changes in vegetation, soil, and water […]
The post Sentinel-2A Given One-Year Exceptional and Temporary Extension appeared first on European Spaceflight.
